member.name: T:Madingley.EnviroData
member.summary: Imports environmental data from ASCII and NetCDF files
member.todoT: Rewrite to use the ArraySDSConvert class
member.todoD: Need to go through code and rewrite e.g. change method to overloaded to prevent passing variable name and file name for ESRI grids
member.remarks: Currently assumes that cells are evenly spaced in latitude and longitude

CHECK IF DIMENSIONS HAVE TO BE THE SAME FOR ALL VARIABLES IN A NETCDF AND HOW TO EXTRACT DIMENSIONS FOR A SINGLE VARIABLE IF NECESSARY
Write code to check for equal cell sizes in NetCDFs

member.name: M:Madingley.EnviroData.GetValue(System.Double,System.Double,System.UInt32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: A method to extract the value of an environmental variable from the grid cell closest to a specified latitude and longitude
member.param: Latitude to get value from
Longitude to get value from
The time interval to get the value from (i.e. the month, or 0 for yearly variables)
Boolean to indicate whether the returned value is a missing value
member.returns: The value of the environmental variable at the grid cell closest to the specified latitude and longitude

member.name: M:Madingley.EnviroData.GetValue(System.Double,System.Double,System.UInt32,System.Boolean@,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: A method to extract the area weighted value of an environmental variable from the envirodata cells overlapped by the cell specified by lat and lon
member.param: Bottom latitude of cell to get value from
Leftmost longitude of cell to get value from
The time interval to get the value from (i.e. the month, or 0 for yearly variables)
Boolean to indicate whether the returned value is a missing value
The latitudinal size of cells in the model grid
The longitudinal size of cells in the model grid
member.returns: The area weighted value of an environmental variable from the envirodata cells overlapped by the cell specified by lat and lon

The name of the variable within the NetCDF file

member.name: M:Madingley.GridCell.CalculateNPPSeasonality(System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate monthly seasonality values of Net Primary Production - ignores missing values. If there is no NPP data (ie all zero or missing values) then assign 1/12 for each month.
member.param: Monthly values of NPP
Missing data value to which the data will be compared against
member.returns: The contribution that each month's NPP makes to annual NPP

Index of the longitude cell for which the weighted average over surrounding cells is requested
Latitude of the cell for which the weighted value is requested
Longitude of the cell for which the weighted value is requested
Names of the data for which weighted value is requested
Realm of the grid cell for which data is to be averaged over
member.returns: The weighted average value of the specified data type across surrounding grid cells of the specified realm

Latitude of the cell for which the weighted value is requested
Longitude of the cell for which the weighted value is requested
Names of the data for which weighted value is requested
Realm of the grid cell for which data is to be averaged over

member.name: T:Madingley.ClimateVariablesCalculator
member.summary: Calculates derived climate variables for which no input data exist

member.name: M:Madingley.ClimateVariablesCalculator.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor the climate variables calculator

member.name: M:Madingley.ClimateVariablesCalculator.MonthlyActualEvapotranspirationSoilMoisture(System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Calculates monthly water balance variables: actual evapotranspiration, soil water deficit, and the an approximation for the length of the fire season. Actual Evapotranspiration and soil moisture was calculated by following Prentice et al (1993) "A simulation model for the transient effects of climate change on forest landscapes", Ecological Modelling, 65, 51-70, but using potential evapotranspiration rates calculated elsewhere (normally the Penman Monteith equation). The approximate length of the fire season was calculated using equations (2) and (4) of Thonicke et al. (2001). "The role of fire disturbance for global vegetation dynamics: coupling fire into a Dynamic Global Vegetation Model". Global Ecology and Biogeography, 10, 661-677.
member.param: The available water capacity of the soil (mm)
Mean monthly precipitation (mm)
Mean monthly temperatures, degrees celcius
member.returns: A Tuple containing i) monthly actual evapotranspiration (mm), ii) soil water deficit (mm) and, iii) fire season length (between 0 and 360 days)

member.name: M:Madingley.ClimateVariablesCalculator.CalculatePotentialEvapotranspiration(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the monthly potential evapotranspiration according to Malmstrom VH (1969) A new approach to the classification of climate. J Geog 68:351â€“357.
member.param: Mean monthly temperature, degrees Celsius
member.returns: Potential Monthly Evapotranspiration, mm

member.name: M:Madingley.ClimateVariablesCalculator.GetNDF(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Estimates the fraction of the year in which the temperature drops below zero at some time in the day according to the the CRU CL 2.0 gridded climate dataset (For details of this dataset see CRU2p0Dataset.txt)
member.param: A vector containing the number of frost days each month
A vector containing average temperatures for each month
The missing value used in the the environmental datasets
member.returns: The fraction of the year in which temperature drops below zero at some point in the day

member.name: M:Madingley.ClimateVariablesCalculator.ApproximateNDF(System.Double[])
member.summary: Calculates the number of days frost using an alternative algorithm to that in ClimateLookup that is based on mean annual temperature data alone. This will probably be a coarse representation of the number of frost days but will do for now.
member.param: Mean monthly temperatures, degrees celcius
member.returns: Fraction of the year that experiences frost

The time step units

member.name: M:Madingley.UtilityFunctions.ConvertTimeUnits(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Calculates factors to convert between different time units
member.param: Time unit to convert from
Time unit to convert to
member.returns: Factor to convert between time units

member.name: M:Madingley.UtilityFunctions.FindJaggedArrayIndex(System.UInt32,System.UInt32[][],System.UInt32)
member.summary: For a given cohort index, return a vector pair of values corresponding to the cohort's location in the jagged array of grid cell cohorts
member.param: The index of the cohort (values range between zero and the number of cohorts in the jagged arrray)
The jaggged array of cohorts, where rows correspond to functional groups, and columns to cohorts within functional groups
The total number of cohorts in the grid cell
member.returns: The position of the specified cohort in the jagged array of grid cell cohorts, where the first value is the row index (functional group) and the second value is the column index (position within functional group)

member.name: M:Madingley.UtilityFunctions.ConvertSqMToSqDegrees(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts values per square km to per square degree, given cell latitude
member.param: The value per square km
The latitude of the grid cell
member.returns: The specified value converted to per square degree

member.name: M:Madingley.UtilityFunctions.LogNormalPDF(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the probability of a particular value under a log-normal distribution with specified mean and standard deviation
member.param: The value to return the probability of under the log-normal distribtuion, in identity space
The mean of the log-normal distribution, in identity space
The standard deviation of the log-normal distribution, in log space
member.returns: The probability of the specified value under the specified log-normal distribution

member.name: M:Madingley.UtilityFunctions.NormalPDF(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the probability of a particular value under a normal distribution with specified mean and standard deviation
member.param: The value to return the probability of under the normal distribtuion
The mean of the normal distribution
The standard deviation of the normal distribution
member.returns: The probability of the specified value under the specified normal distribution

member.name: M:Madingley.UtilityFunctions.CalculateGridCellArea(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate the area of a grid cell in square km, given its dimensions and geographical position
member.param: The latitude of the bottom-left corner of the grid cell
The longitudinal dimension of the grid cell
The latitudinal dimension of the grid cell
member.returns: The area in square km of the grid cell

member.name: M:Madingley.UtilityFunctions.CalculateLengthOfDegreeLatitude(System.Single)
member.summary: Calculate the length of a degree of latitude at a particular latitude
member.param: The latitude of the bottom-left corner of the grid cell
member.returns: The length of a degree of latitude in kilometres

member.name: M:Madingley.UtilityFunctions.CalculateLengthOfDegreeLongitude(System.Single)
member.summary: Calculate the length of a degree of longitude at a particular latitude
member.param: The latitude of the bottom-left corner of the grid cell
member.returns: The length of a degree of longitude in kilometres

member.name: M:Madingley.UtilityFunctions.DegreesToRadians(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert from degrees to radians
member.param: The value in degrees to convert
member.returns: The value converted to radians
